description.narrative: The Project is expected to have a significant development impacts by maintaining funding for trade of critical agricultural inputs and commodities to/from the LAC region. The CCFP is aimed at helping to address the current liquidity constraint faced by both financial institutions and real sector businesses. The CCFP-Bladex facility is expected to have the following development impacts: - Maintaining access to finance: The Project will maintain the availability of trade and commodity finance mainly for the agriculture sector across many countries in LAC, including lower income countries in Central America. Supporting the stability of credit for the agricultural sector is expected to benefit multiple companies along the agricultural value chain and, thus, support continued growth, sustain employment and encourage the generation of higher incomes going forward. Its support of agricultural imports will enhance food security and help to mitigate potential negative effects of a decrease in the supply of critical staples. - Strong demonstration effect: IFC will act as a catalyst among others international finance institutions ("IFIs") by supporting commodity backed finance and market reach through partnerships with banks. This will promote commodities as an asset class and encourage banks to participate in funding the critical agricultural sector, which will ultimately help increase access to finance and develop local markets.

The proposed Project falls under the Critical Commodities Finance Program (CCFP or the Program) (Project No. 31679) approved by the Board on January 12, 2012 as part of IFCs multi-faceted rapid response to the current financial crisis. Phase two of the Program was approved by the Board on January 31, 2013. The proposed project involves establishing a funded risk-sharing facility (Facility) with Banco Latinomericano de Comercio Externo S.A. (Bladex or the Bank) for the purpose of providing short-term trade and commodity related financing to local regional commercial entities operating in the agribusiness sector (Project).
